analyzed: de nas dbyangs yig dmar po de rnams la sbrang ma dga' ba rgyas pa dag bsgoms nas rang gi sngags kyi 'od zer gyi tshogs bcug ste /
translated: Then, having meditated on those red vowels as bees, one should imagine that they enter the mass of light rays of one's mantra.

original: de snyed mngon par 'dod pa'i bud med kyi gnas su song nas rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng du stobs kyis gzhag par bya'o ;

analyzed: /'od zer gyi rang bzhin gyi zhags pas mgul nas legs par bcings te /

translated: Then, with a very red, fine, sharp hook arisen from the light rays of one‚Äôs mantra syllable, one should summon the syllable h≈´·πÉ that is on the lotus filament with light rays that go above and return, following a swarm of bees.

original: ba dang ldan pas rang gis na bug g-yas pa nas cig shos su zhugs shing 'thon nas bsgrub bya'i sna bug g-yas pa nas zhugs nas de'i snying gar zhugs te /
analyzed: ba dang ldan pas rang gis na bug g-yas pa nas cig shos su zhugs shing 'thon nas bsgrub bya'i sna bug g-yas pa nas zhugs nas de'i snying gar zhugs te /

translated: The hook, by the power of his name, draws it out. The bees, with great delight, come out from that lotus and, of their own accord, suck the nectar of his voice and make it old.üîΩOne should look at this for a very long time without moving.

analyzed: sbrang bu de rnams kyis kyang rang gi dbyangs yig de'i sna bug g-yon pa'i lam du zhugs shing 'thon par blta bar bya'o //

analyzed: de'i ming gi yi ge rang gi snying ga'i sngags kyis drag tu mnan nas /

original: dbyangs rnams 'dab ma so so la sbrang bu mchog gis dbang du byas par rnam par bsam par bya'o zhes pa 'di'i rim pas rang gi rnam par shes pa dang / de'i rnam par shes pa gcig tu blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbyangs rnams 'dab ma so so la sbrang bu mchog gis dbang du byas par rnam par bsam par bya'o zhes pa 'di'i rim pas rang gi rnam par shes pa dang / de'i rnam par shes pa gcig tu blta bar bya'o //
translated: By this process, one should view one‚Äôs consciousness and his consciousness as one.

original: de nas de'i nu ma autpa la dmar po'i mde'u rnon po dang ldan pa'i mdzas phug nas 'dod chags chen pos brgyal te /
analyzed: de nas de'i nu ma autpa la dmar po'i mde'u rnon po dang ldan pa'i mdzas phug nas 'dod chags chen pos brgyal te /
translated: Then, with a lotus flower with a sharp red utpala tip, one should pierce her breast and look at her fainting from great passion.

original: 'gyel bar blta zhing lcags sgrog lta bu'i rgyud kyis de'i rkang pa gnyis dam por bcings nas /
analyzed: 'gyel bar blta zhing lcags sgrog lta bu'i rgyud kyis de'i rkang pa gnyis dam por bcings nas /
translated: Binding her two feet tightly with a chain-like rope,üîΩone should bind her neck with a noose that is the nature of the stalk of the utpala flower that one is holding, and having drawn her in, one should make her fall between one‚Äôs two feet.

original: rang gis bzung ba'i autpa la'i sdong bu'i rang bzhin gyi zhags pas mgul nas bcings te yang dag par bkug nas rang gi rkang pa gnyis kyi bar du lhung bar byas nas mya ngan med pas snying gar bsnun cing mngon pa'i nga rgyal med par byas nas ral
analyzed: rang gis bzung ba'i autpa la'i sdong bu'i rang bzhin gyi zhags pas mgul nas bcings te yang dag par bkug nas rang gi rkang pa gnyis kyi bar du lhung bar byas nas mya ngan med pas snying gar bsnun cing mngon pa'i nga rgyal med par byas nas ral
translated: Having pierced her heart with an a≈õoka flower, one should remove her pride.

analyzed: gris 'jigs par byas shing skyabs gzhan med par byas te ;
translated: Having frightened her with a sword, one should remove her other refuges.

original: yang me long gi bdag nyid ji ltar gnas pa skra grol zhing gcer bu shin tu chags pas myos shing bral bas 'jigs pa shin tu gus pas brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: yang me long gi bdag nyid ji ltar gnas pa skra grol zhing gcer bu shin tu chags pas myos shing bral bas 'jigs pa shin tu gus pas brtan par bya'o //
translated: Again, one should stand in the manner of a mirror, with loose hair and naked, intoxicated with passion, and terrified of separation. One should stand firmly with great devotion.

original: rang rig pas rjes su chags par bya'o //
analyzed: rang rig pas rjes su chags par bya'o //
translated: One should be passionately in love with oneself.

original: aom che ge mo a'a karsha ya manydzu gho sha hr'i:dza:zhes pa'i rang gi sngags ming dang bcas pa rtse gcig pa'i sems kyis bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: aom che ge mo a'a karsha ya manydzu gho sha hr'i:dza:zhes pa'i rang gi sngags ming dang bcas pa rtse gcig pa'i sems kyis bzlas par bya'o //
translated: One should recite the mantra ‚ÄúO·πÅ, so-and-so, I summon you! J√±ƒÅnaj√±ƒÅninƒ´! Hri·∏• ja·∏•!‚Äù with one‚Äôs own name, with a one-pointed mind.

original: de nas gong du gsungs pa'i rim pas dkar po'i mchog gi tshes gcig nas brtsams te ji srid tshes bcu bzhi'i bar du khri phrag gcig tsam bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gong du gsungs pa'i rim pas dkar po'i mchog gi tshes gcig nas brtsams te ji srid tshes bcu bzhi'i bar du khri phrag gcig tsam bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, beginning on the first day of the bright fortnight, following the previously described procedure, one should recite the mantra ten thousand times each day until the fourteenth.

original: yang tshes bco lnga la mchod pa rnam pa rgya chen po byas nas mtshan thog thag bzlas par bya'o ;
analyzed: yang tshes bco lnga la mchod pa rnam pa rgya chen po byas nas mtshan thog thag bzlas par bya'o ;
translated: Again, on the fifteenth, one should perform extensive worship and recite the mantra throughout the night.

original: / de nas tho rangs nges par 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de nas tho rangs nges par 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, at dawn, she will certainly come.

original: 'ongs pa na de la yang phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi don du rang gi lha rnams mchod pa'i bsam pas ji ltar bde bar longs spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'ongs pa na de la yang phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub kyi don du rang gi lha rnams mchod pa'i bsam pas ji ltar bde bar longs spyad par bya'o //
translated: When they arrive, one should enjoy them as one likes, with the thought of worshipping one's own deity, for the sake of the attainment of the Great Seal.

original: 'jam dpal yan lag med pa'i rdo rje'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
analyzed: 'jam dpal yan lag med pa'i rdo rje'i sgrub thabs rdzogs so//
